intro: Premna rubens, commonly known as red-veined mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red veins on its heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale pink or white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
